title: At CWC meeting, what Congress top brass discussed: Concerns about tie-up with AAP, Sanatan Dharma row
selftext: After leaders from Punjab and Delhi argue against a tie-up with Arvind Kejriwalâ€™s party, Mallikarjun Kharge assures top party panel that alliances and seat-sharing will be decided after consulting state units
comments: >Sources said Partap Singh Bajwa, the Leader of the Opposition in Punjab, andÂ DelhiÂ Congress leaders Ajay Maken and Alka Lamba voiced concerns about an electoral tie-up with the AAP. While Bajwa pointed out that the sentiment of the party cadre of Punjab was against any understanding with theÂ Arvind Kejriwal-led party, which is in power in the state, Maken said the AAP was putting up candidates against the Congress in Chhattisgarh and Madhya Pradesh. Maken is the chairperson of the screening committee for picking candidates in Chhattisgarh. Bajwa also told theÂ CWCÂ that if the ruling party and the main Opposition party in Punjab join hands, it will help theÂ BJPÂ and the Shiromani Akali Dal.
After so many years.. itâ€™s still not clear to me if AAP is Cong B team or BJP B team.. ğŸ§

[To AAP or not to AAP? Delhi Congress waits for high command cues, party divided in Punjab](https://indianexpress.com/article/political-pulse/delhi-congress-aap-punjab-tie-up-8944796/)

>While a section of the grand old partyâ€™s leaders in the national capital believes an alliance is a â€œdone dealâ€, others say it is a question of how far the party is willing to go to accommodate the Kejriwal-led party. In Punjab, the naysayers have the upper hand at present.

>On Saturday, the first day of theÂ CWCÂ meeting,Â Janata DalÂ (United) leader K C Tyagi set political circles abuzz with his comments inÂ Chandigarh. Tyagi said he had spoken toÂ Arvind KejriwalÂ and claimed that theÂ DelhiÂ Chief Minister â€œis ready to have an alliance withÂ Indian National CongressÂ party for elections inÂ Delhiâ€. Tyagi made this statement at a press conference he addressed along with the Indian National Lok Dalâ€™s Abhay Chautala.

>â€œThere is slight trouble with the AAP inÂ Delhi, Punjab and Haryana. But, I would only like to mention thatÂ BJPÂ has all 10 seats (in Haryana), if we want to defeat them, there should be the INLD and AAP too. I spoke withÂ Arvind KejriwalÂ inÂ Delhi, he is ready to go with the Congress. I would also like to request the Congress that it should also take the initiative and have a large heart. I only spoke with him aboutÂ Delhi. He (Arvind Kejriwal) is ready to have an alliance with the Congress inÂ Delhi.â€

>At theÂ CWCÂ meeting, Lovely did not vociferously voice concerns about a tie-up with the AAP unlike hisÂ DelhiÂ Congress colleagues Ajay Maken and Alka Lamba, and Punjab Leader of the Opposition Partap Singh Bajwa, who came out vehemently against any such alliance.

>Sources in the Congress believe that an alliance with the AAP â€” in the national capital at least â€” is more or less a â€œdone dealâ€, with the senior state leadership having underlined that it is the need of the hour.
Would be a terrible deal to be bjp's considering all the fire they get through through the governor and lg
